parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden and violent shaking of the front end of the vehicle can cause loss of control, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The front end of the vehicle shakes violently
the steering wheel moves rapidly and strongly
alternating between clockwise and counterclockwise movements
making it difficult to maintain control of the vehicle; the vehicle hops and shakes in a dangerous way when hitting a bump or road imperfection.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Loss of Power Steering and Engine Stalling
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden loss of power steering and engine stalling can cause loss of control, leading to accidents or near-misses, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: and the vehicle becomes difficult to control; the vehicle shakes violently and loses power steering when hitting a bump or road imperfection.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the FICM can cause the engine to suddenly die, resulting in loss of power, steering, and brakes, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
The failure of the high pressure oil system can cause the engine to suddenly die, resulting in loss of power, steering, and brakes, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
The failure of fuel system components can cause the engine to malfunction, resulting in loss of power, difficulty starting the engine, and increased repair costs.
Spark plug thread failure can cause engine misfires, decreased engine performance, and potentially lead to engine damage.
EGR cooler failure can cause white smoke to emit from the tailpipe, loss of engine power, and potentially lead to turbocharger and head gasket failure, which can result in costly repairs.
symptoms: White smoke coming out of the tailpipe
failure of the turbocharger and head gaskets.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: High pressure oil pump failure can cause engine failure, leading to costly repairs and potentially leaving the driver stranded.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: EP Sensor Failure and Recall Maintenance Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: EP sensor failure can cause issues with the vehicle's drivability and performance, and failure to properly address recall maintenance can lead to further problems.
The failure of the turbocharger can cause a sudden loss of engine power, making it difficult to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: strong odor of exhaust in the cabin.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden loss of engine power can cause the vehicle to stall or become difficult to control, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: strong odor of exhaust in the cabin.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The unreliable engine performance can cause the vehicle to stall or become difficult to control, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: strong odor of exhaust in the cabin.
